result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jonathan Rivera-Ojeda

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Jonathan Rivera-Ojeda in court with attorney Torrie R. Williams.  Ann R. Lopez appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

FILE NOT IN COURT.   Dawn Maldonado, interpreter, sworn-in.  Deferred Prosecution Agreement received and filed.  Court approves the agreement.  On motion of the State, Court orders case DISMISSED and read-in for sentencing purposes in case 15cm213.

Defendant Jonathan Rivera-Ojeda in court with attorney Torrie R. Williams.  Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC. Case calendared for status conference. Defendant has a pending felony in Branch 44, defense counsel reviewing for global resolution in Branch 44.   Court ordered case adjourned for status conference/projected guilty plea in Branch 37.   Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date is signed and filed.  Status conference scheduled for March 26, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Jonathan Rivera-Ojeda in court with attorney Torrie R. Williams.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  AA.  Pretrial conference held off the record.  Defense counsel needs more time for further plea negotiations.    Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 37.    Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date is signed and filed.  Status conference scheduled for March 9, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings. Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with 1515 S. 8th St., Milwaukee, WI.

Defendant Jonathan Rivera-Ojeda in court with attorney Terese M. Dick.  Defendant Jonathan Rivera-Ojeda in custody.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  HMP
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dee, Branch 37.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION. Pre-trial conference scheduled for February 17, 2015 at 8:30am.

ADDRESS INFO for Jonathan Rivera-Ojeda
Current: 1515 W. Orchard St., Milwaukee, WI 53204   (Effective: 02-12-2015)
Prior: 1820 West Wells Street, Milwaukee, WI 53228
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
